QAPair.Question: What is (are) Collateral ligament (CL) injury - aftercare ?
QAPair.Answer: A ligament is a band of tissue that connects a bone to another bone. The collateral ligaments of the knee are located on either side of your knee outside your knee joint. They help connect the bones of your upper and lower leg, around your knee joint. The lateral collateral ligament (LCL) runs on the outer side of your knee., The medial collateral ligament (MCL) runs along the inner side of your knee. , A collateral ligament injury occurs when the ligaments are stretched or torn. A partial tear occurs when only part of the ligament is torn. A complete tear occurs when the entire ligament is torn into two pieces.
